title: Absolute threshold and hearing loss - graph

content.question: Which of the following statements is best supported by the graph?

choices.label: People in their 20s have more difficulty hearing higher frequency sounds than people in their 60s.
People who are 90 years old show no difficulty hearing frequencies at the 2,000 level when played at the 40 decibel level.
As people get older, their ability to hear higher frequency sounds decreases.
In general, a sixty-year-old person cannot hear higher decibel levels at higher frequencies.

content.answer: As people get older, their ability to hear higher frequency sounds decreases.
